title: Contributing
Contributing
text: Create issue describing change. Work branch open pull request. Ensure R CMD check passes tests cover change.

title: Contributing
text: Use tidyverse style. Run lintr::lint_package() possible.

title: Contributing
text: Please open issue include minimal reproducible example.

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Watson O (2026). vpdsus: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation Risk Scanning. R package version 0.0.1, https://ojwatson.github.io/vpdsus/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vpdsus: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning},   author = {Oliver Watson},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://ojwatson.github.io/vpdsus/}, }

what: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: vpdsus R package retrieve Global Health Observatory (GHO) immunisation coverage reported cases, combine demography, estimate vaccine-preventable disease susceptibility via progressive methods (–E), produce -style risk ranking plots modelling outputs.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("OJWatson/vpdsus")

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
code: library(vpdsus)  panel <- vpdsus_example_panel()  sA <- estimate_susceptible_static(panel, coverage_col = "coverage", pop_col = "pop_0_4") rank <- risk_rank(panel = panel, suscept = sA)  p1 <- plot_coverage_rank(rank) p2 <- plot_susceptible_rank(rank)  p1 p2

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
text: Data access functions cache-aware record provenance. Vignettes designed run quickly using shipped example datasets. full end--end pipeline scaffold provided analysis/targets/.

title: Vaccine Preventable Disease Susceptibility Estimation and Risk Scanning
Build a country-year panel — build_panel
Build a country-year panel — build_panel
code: build_panel(coverage, cases, demography)

title: Build a country-year panel — build_panel
text: coverage tibble get_coverage() (iso3, year, coverage). cases tibble get_cases() (iso3, year, cases). demography tibble get_demography().

title: Build a country-year panel — build_panel

what: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
text: Calibrate reporting fraction rho susceptible balance recurrence used estimate_susceptible_case_balance() model matches target susceptible count chosen time.

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
code: calibrate_rho_case_balance(   panel,   iso3,   years,   target_year,   target_susceptible_n,   births_col = "births",   coverage_col = "coverage",   cases_col = "cases",   s0 = NULL,   ve = 1,   rho_interval = c(1e-04, 1) )

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
text: panel Panel data.frame/tibble containing least iso3/year/births, coverage, cases columns. iso3 ISO3 code filter panel. years Vector years (integers) use recurrence. Must covered panel iso3. target_year Year match target_susceptible_n. target_susceptible_n Target susceptible count target_year. births_col Births column. coverage_col Coverage column. cases_col Cases column. s0 Initial susceptible count first year; defaults births first year. ve Vaccine effectiveness multiplier applied coverage computing vaccinated births. rho_interval Search interval rho.

title: Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance
Calibrate rho for the case-balance susceptible recurrence — calibrate_rho_case_balance

title: Compare susceptibility trajectories across methods — compare_methods
Compare susceptibility trajectories across methods — compare_methods
code: compare_methods(panel, estimates, iso3)

title: Compare susceptibility trajectories across methods — compare_methods
text: panel panel iso3/year. estimates Named list susceptibility tibbles. iso3 Country ISO3.

what: Method D: susceptible balance updated using cases — estimate_susceptible_case_balance
title: Method D: susceptible balance updated using cases — estimate_susceptible_case_balance
text: Method D: susceptible balance updated using cases

title: Method D: susceptible balance updated using cases — estimate_susceptible_case_balance
code: estimate_susceptible_case_balance(   panel,   rho = c(0.05, 0.1, 0.2, 0.5, 1),   coverage_col = "coverage",   births_col = "births",   cases_col = "cases",   pop_col = "pop_total",   age_group = "total",   s0 = NULL )

title: Method D: susceptible balance updated using cases — estimate_susceptible_case_balance
text: panel Panel births, coverage, cases. rho Reporting fraction (scalar vector). coverage_col Name coverage column. births_col Name births column. cases_col Name reported cases column. pop_col Name population column used proportions. age_group Label returned age_group column. s0 Optional initial susceptible count (defaults births first year).

title: Method D: susceptible balance updated using cases — estimate_susceptible_case_balance

text: Method B: cohort reconstruction using births + coverage

title: Method B: cohort reconstruction using births + coverage — estimate_susceptible_cohort
code: estimate_susceptible_cohort(   panel,   years_back = 4,   coverage_col = "coverage",   births_col = "births",   pop_col = "pop_0_4",   age_group = "0-4" )

title: Method B: cohort reconstruction using births + coverage — estimate_susceptible_cohort
text: panel vpd_panel tibble iso3, year, births, pop_0_4, coverage. years_back Integer; number years age group window (default 4 0-4). coverage_col Coverage column. births_col Births column. pop_col Population denominator column. age_group Label.

title: Method B: cohort reconstruction using births + coverage — estimate_susceptible_cohort

title: Method C: cohort reconstruction with two doses + vaccine efficacy — estimate_susceptible_cohort_ve
code: estimate_susceptible_cohort_ve(   panel,   years_back = 4,   c1_col = "mcv1",   c2_col = "mcv2",   births_col = "births",   pop_col = "pop_0_4",   age_group = "0-4",   ve1 = 0.93,   ve2 = 0.97 )

title: Method C: cohort reconstruction with two doses + vaccine efficacy — estimate_susceptible_cohort_ve
text: panel Panel coverage columns dose1 dose2. years_back Integer; number years age group window (default 4 0-4). c1_col Coverage dose 1. c2_col Coverage dose 2. births_col Births column. pop_col Population denominator column. age_group Label. ve1 Vaccine efficacy dose 1. ve2 Vaccine efficacy dose 2.

title: Method A: static coverage-based susceptibility — estimate_susceptible_static
text: panel vpd_panel tibble. coverage_col Name coverage column (proportion 0-1). pop_col Population column age group interest. age_group Label returned age_group column. ve Vaccine efficacy (default 1).

title: Method A: static coverage-based susceptibility — estimate_susceptible_static
text: tibble iso3, year, age_group, susceptible_n, susceptible_prop, method.

Get demography series — get_demography
text: Retrieves demography required susceptibility estimation. default, uses small shipped example dataset vignettes tests. full implementation can added via WPP (Suggests) APIs.

title: Get demography series — get_demography
code: get_demography(years = NULL, countries = NULL, source = c("example", "wpp"))

title: Get demography series — get_demography
text: years Optional integer vector. countries Optional ISO3 vector. source One "example" (default) "wpp" (optional).

title: Get demography series — get_demography
text: tibble iso3, year, pop_total, pop_0_4, pop_5_14, births.

what: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
text: Convenience helper construct inputs= discrete-time susceptible balance odin2 model (model = "balance_discrete").

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
code: odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel(   panel,   times,   iso3,   year_col = "year",   births_col = "births",   coverage_col = "coverage",   cases_col = "cases",   ve = 1 )

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
text: panel Panel data.frame/tibble containing least iso3, year, births, coverage, cases columns (configurable via *_col). times Numeric/integer vector times (typically years) align . iso3 ISO3 code filter panel. year_col Year column. births_col Births column. coverage_col Coverage column interval [0, 1]; values outside clamped. (Coverage values bounded interval [0, 1].) cases_col Cases column. ve Vaccine effectiveness multiplier applied coverage computing vaccinated births (vaccinated = births * coverage * ve).

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
text: Named list numeric vectors births, vaccinated, cases, length length(times).

title: Build susceptible-balance inputs from a panel — odin2_balance_inputs_from_panel
Compile an odin2 template — odin2_build_model
Compile an odin2 template — odin2_build_model
code: odin2_build_model(   model = c("balance", "balance_discrete", "sir", "minimal_discrete"),   file = NULL )

title: Compile an odin2 template — odin2_build_model
text: model One 'balance', 'balance_discrete', 'sir', 'minimal_discrete'. file Optional path custom template.

title: Compile an odin2 template — odin2_build_model

what: Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
title: Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
code: odin2_inputs_from_tibble(   data,   times,   cols = c("births", "vaccinated", "cases"),   time_col = "year",   iso3 = NULL,   iso3_col = "iso3" )

title: Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
text: data data frame/tibble containing time column (default year) one input columns (e.g. births, vaccinated, cases). times Numeric/integer vector times (typically years) align . cols Character vector input column names extract. time_col Name time column data. iso3 Optional ISO3 code filter data contains multiple countries. iso3_col Name ISO3 column data.

title: Build odin2 input vectors from a year-keyed tibble — odin2_inputs_from_tibble
text: Named list numeric vectors, length length(times).

title: Simulate an odin2 model — odin2_simulate
text: model Compiled model odin2_build_model(). times Numeric vector. pars Named list. initial Named list. inputs Optional named list input vectors (difference-equation models).

title: Simulate an odin2 model — odin2_simulate

what: Compute risk categories and ranking tables — risk_rank
title: Compute risk categories and ranking tables — risk_rank
Compute risk categories and ranking tables — risk_rank
code: risk_rank(   panel,   suscept,   window_years = 15,   year_end = NULL,   breaks = c(0, 0.5, 0.7, 0.85, 1) )

title: Compute risk categories and ranking tables — risk_rank
text: panel vpd_panel including least iso3, year, who_region (optional), coverage. suscept Output estimation function (Method /B/etc). window_years Integer; rolling window coverage mean. year_end Optional; year rank (defaults max year available). breaks Coverage breakpoints risk categories.

title: Compute risk categories and ranking tables — risk_rank

what: A joined country-year panel for VPD susceptibility — vpd_panel
title: A joined country-year panel for VPD susceptibility — vpd_panel
text: vpd_panel tibble additional class used throughout {vpdsus}. typically created build_panel() vpdsus_example_panel().

title: A joined country-year panel for VPD susceptibility — vpd_panel
text: Minimum expected columns: iso3 (character) year (integer) coverage (numeric) cases (numeric) demography columns pop_total, pop_0_4, pop_5_14, births object may carry join diagnostics attr(x, "diagnostics").

title: Internal imports — vpdsus-internal

what: vpdsus: VPD susceptibility estimation and risk scanning — vpdsus
title: vpdsus: VPD susceptibility estimation and risk scanning — vpdsus
text: Tools retrieve GHO immunisation coverage reported cases, join demography, estimate susceptibility via progressive methods (–E), produce -style risk ranking plots, link susceptibility outbreaks.

title: vpdsus: VPD susceptibility estimation and risk scanning — vpdsus
text: users start : get_coverage(), get_cases(), get_demography() build_panel() estimate_susceptible_static(), estimate_susceptible_cohort() risk_rank(), plot_coverage_rank(), plot_susceptible_rank()

title: vpdsus: VPD susceptibility estimation and risk scanning — vpdsus

what: Example panel shipped with the package — vpdsus_example_panel
title: Example panel shipped with the package — vpdsus_example_panel
Example panel shipped with the package — vpdsus_example_panel
code: vpdsus_example_panel()

title: Example panel shipped with the package — vpdsus_example_panel
vpdsus 0.0.1
text: Initial package scaffolding. Data access helpers (GHO OData) caching. Panel building, susceptibility estimation methods –D, plotting. Modelling helpers odin2 scaffolding (optional).
